xxl.core.xml.storage
Class SubtreeConverter

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.converters.Converter<T>
      xxl.core.io.converters.SizeConverter
          xxl.core.xml.storage.SubtreeConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class SubtreeConverter
extends SizeConverter

Converter which converts a whole subtree (usually to store it inside a Record).

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
SubtreeConverter(NodeConverter nodeConverter, FixedSizeConverter idConverter)
          Constructs a converter for a whole subtree.

SubtreeConverter

public SubtreeConverter(NodeConverter nodeConverter,
                        FixedSizeConverter idConverter)
Constructs a converter for a whole subtree.

Parameters:
nodeConverter - Converter which is used for a single node.
idConverter - Converter which is used to convert the identifyer.
Method Detail

read

public Object read(DataInput dataInput,
                   Object object)
            throws IOException
Reads the whole subtree and returns the root node.

Specified by:
read in class Converter
Parameters:
dataInput - the dataInput with the serialized tree
object - the object to be restored. When object == null a new object should be created and restored.
Returns:
the root-node
Throws:
IOException - if I/O errors occur.
See Also:
Converter.read(java.io.DataInput, java.lang.Object)

write

public void write(DataOutput dataOutput,
                  Node node,
                  short internalFatherId)
           throws IOException
Serializes the subtree and renews the internal ids which are necessary for the reconstruction process of the tree. The nodes are stored in pre-order (this is very important for the read operation).

Parameters:
dataOutput - the outputStream where to store the serialized tree
node - the root node of the tree
internalFatherId - internal identifyer of the father node used for reconstruction of the tree.
Throws:
IOException - if an IO Exception occurs
See Also:
Converter.write(java.io.DataOutput, java.lang.Object)

write

public void write(DataOutput dataOutput,
                  Object object)
           throws IOException
Serializes the subtree to the given dataOutput stream. This means not the complete tree, its just a subtree, which ends at the proxy nodes. This subtree usually ist a subttree that will be stored in one record.

Specified by:
write in class Converter
Parameters:
dataOutput - the outputStream where to store the serialized tree
object - the root node of the tree
Throws:
IOException - if an IO Exception occurs
See Also:
Converter.write(java.io.DataOutput, java.lang.Object)

getSerializedSizeWithoutParentId

public int getSerializedSizeWithoutParentId(Object o)
Calculates and return the size of the subtree with the given root-node disregarding the size of the parentId of the node itself. Note, that this doesn't mean the complete tree. Just the subtree, that ends at the leaf nodes or at the proxy nodes.

Parameters:
o - the root node of the tree
Returns:
the size in bytes.

getSerializedSize

public int getSerializedSize(Object o)
Calculates and return the size of the subtree with the given root-node. Note, that this doesn't mean the complete tree. Just the subtree, that ends at the leafnodes or at the proxy nodes.

Overrides:
getSerializedSize in class SizeConverter
Parameters:
o - the root node of the tree
Returns:
the size in bytes.
